data.title: input doesn't work in x11 (64bit) export
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Kubuntu 17.04, Godot git master, Geforce 840m 

(templates are same version as godot)

**Issue description:**
when exporting the project game starts fine, and seems to be running (animations work) but input doesn't do anything. keyboard, or gamepad doesn't seem to respond.  

**Steps to reproduce:**
export to linux_x11_64, run the project, try to control the character.

data.title: Searchable Key-Bindings in editor
data.body: Adds The Feature to search for Keys in the Shortcut list instead of just the name of the events.

data.title: RichTextLabel does not perform well 'out of the box'
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Godot 2.1.4

**Issue description:**
The behavior of RichTextLabel is unsatisfactory.  One cannot simply do:  
```#self is GridContainer  
var node = RichTextLabel.new()  
node.set_bbcode("Some Text")  
add_child(node)
```
 
And have it work.

Instead, one must do:  
```#self is GridContainer  
var node = RichTextLabel.new()  
init_richtextlabel(node)  
node.set_bbcode("Some Text")  
add_child(node)  
...  
func init_richtextlabel(node):  
	node.set_use_bbcode(true) #Not strictly necessary, but otherwise we would use Label. 
	node.set_scroll_active(false) #Not strictly necessary, but this behavior is distinctly different from Label.  
	node.set_custom_minimum_size(Vector2(50, 16)) #This or the next two lines, depending on desired behavior  
	#node.set_h_size_flags(SIZE_EXPAND_FILL)  
	#node.set_v_size_flags(SIZE_EXPAND_FILL)  
```

A side note is that `node.set_v_size_flags(SIZE_EXPAND)` does not work as expected to make the node size match the text size and using SIZE_EXPAND_FILL can be undesirable.

**Expected Behavior:**
RichTextLabel nodes behave more comparable to Label nodes, automatically sizing them to match their contents and use_bbcode flag by default is set to true.

data.title: Godot editor - AnimatedSprite node - add spriteFrames editor automatically to the bottom panel when the node is selected and has it as a resource
data.body:
Every time the user wants to edit the sprite frames of an animated sprite node, he/she has to find the sprite frames resource in the inspector, then click once to bring up the resource menu and again to bring up the sprite frames window opening it , then adding it to the bottom panel.

My suggestion is to have godot editor automatically check the AnimatedSprite node upon selection -if it has a spriteframes resource, then add the sprite  frames button to the bottom panel - without any need from the user to click and dig to get to it.

I know that this can be done with the addon system and I have already done it for myself- but I strongly believe that it should be a part of godot's design.

The sprite frames editor is a pain in the arse to get to, considering that it will disappear,along with its button in the bottom panel every time you click on any other node in the scene.

Lets reduce the number of clicks required by the user to get to it - they really add up

data.title: Add donors to the editor About box
data.body:
As promised in the perks of the [Patreon campaign](https://www.patreon.com/godotengine), donors of $10+/month should be added to the About box, with:
- Platinum sponsors first (currently there are none, but the logic for them should be implemented)
- Gold sponsors then
- All donors at $14+ then
- All donors at $10+ afterwards

I've added a `DONORS.md` file in 2753044d06bec370b6379fde5f69a39af4a468ad that should be parsable like we do for `AUTHORS.md` to populate the About box. There should likely be a separate "Donors" tab for it.

CC @Noshyaar who did a great job on the AUTHORS.md stuff already.

data.title: [GDNative] merge of NativeScript and GDNative, new GDNative singletons
data.body:
A GDNativeLibrary now has a field "singleton_gdnative" which can be
used to let the `godot_gdnative_singleton` procedure be executed on
Godot's startup. In future this can be used to register new
scripting languages or resource importer types.

data.body: Enabled smooth scrolling for the shader editor.

the docs convert '\n' to '\n\n'

what is the idea behind it?
and wouldn't it be better to add two new lines in the classes.xml where it actually makes sense?

data.title: TileMap bucket-fill usability
data.body:
It would be very handy to:

a) Have a keyboard shortcut for the TileMap bucket-fill. Select and duplicate already 
    have one (Ctrl-B & Ctrl-D).

b) Keep the bucket-fill selected after using it. For this it would also be nice to have a keyboard shortcut for 
    "pick tile" to go back into the default editing mode.

**Edit:**
A keyboard shortcut for transpose tile would also be nice.

I would like to work on this issue and propose the following shortcuts:
- Bucket fill (G)
- Paint Tile (P)
- Transpose Tile (T)

Setting bucket fill to (G) instead of the more obvious (B) would prevent accidentally miss-pressing (B) while selecting with (CTRL-B). It also is a common bucket-fill-shortcut in painting programs like Aseprite.

data.title: Custom types added via EditorPlugin do not have their imported image listed under "Recent" when selecting a node
data.body:
Godot 3.0, Windows x64

The actual list will show it properly and the node hierarchy in Scene dock does, but in the Create New Node window, the bottom-left section labeled "Recent" does not use the imported image and defaults to a white box.

Check out the icons for "HoverContainer" as a comparison in the below screenshot:
![this screenshot](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16217563/30000556-7704e35a-9036-11e7-91e8-aaccff61c01e.png)

data.title: LineEdit in Tree is aligned vertical center
data.body: it's from #10896

data.title: Negative modulus returns a negative rather than 0 to modulus value
data.body:
Godot 3.0, Windows x64

`print(str(-1 % 3))` prints `-1` to Output when it should be `2`. Positive numbers are modded properly.
I'm confused exactly how this is happening since I traced it, but found perfectly reasonable stuff (line numbers might be a bit off since my version is a few days old).

    gd_tokenizer.cpp: 758: _make_token(TK_OP_MOD)
    gd_parser.cpp: 1063: op = OperatorNode::OP_MOD
    gd_parser.cpp: 1695: _REDUCE_BINARY(Variant::OP_MODULE)
    gd_parser.cpp: 1629: Variant::evaluate(m_vop, static_cast<ConstantNode *>(op->arguments[0])->value, static_cast<ConstantNode *>(op->arguments[1])->value, res, valid); \
    variant_op.cpp: 829: _RETURN(p_a._data._int % p_b._data._int);

Having confirmed that both _int values would've been `int64_t` types, it's strange.
Two integers running `%` between them should yield a non-negative answer, so I'm very confused.

data.title: Prevent sending MainLoop notifications before initialized
data.body: These notifications can currently end up being sent to the MainLoop before it's instantiated

data.title: Automatically create ZIP archives for macOS and iOS templates
data.body:
Just like the HTML5 templates (as of 3.0), ZIP archives should automatically be created when building macOS or iOS templates.

However, macOS and iOS templates currently expect both the debug and release-mode binaries to be in the same archive. Perhaps this should be changed before this can be done (as not everyone will be building both targets).

Not sure, duplicate animation, rename, edit, switch away from node, come back later :)

data.title: Fix unused variable warnings
data.body: The forth in my quest to make Godot 3.x compile with -Werror on GCC7

data.title: Added support for drag and drop in spatial editor.
data.body:
![drag_n_drop](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12756047/29998364-e38373cc-9020-11e7-91d8-eeb1c7636bce.gif)
Adds drag and drop support to the spatial editor with similar functionality to the canvas editor with cached previews too. The preview will also have a bounding box calculated which will allow dragged objects to intersect with other meshes for better alignment. Both the spatial and canvas editor also now use queue_free instead of direct memory freeing since this could cause crashes if a preview is dragged between multiple viewports very quickly. Will also add to the root node of a scene now if no node is selected; this functionality has also been extended to the canvas editor too.

Makes the user experience of the 3D editor much more useful.

data.title: DocData: Include enum attributes in return nodes
data.body: Fixes 3. of #10884

data.title: HTML not showing Image created with "ImageTexture.create_from_image"
data.body:
Godot 2.1.4
X11

Example
```
extends Node2D


func _ready():
	
	var texture = ImageTexture.new()
	texture.load("res://icon.png")
	texture.set_flags(2)
	
	var image = texture.get_data()
	
	var texture2 = ImageTexture.new()
	texture2.create_from_image(image.get_rect(Rect2(0,0,64,64)),2)
	
	get_node("Sprite").set_texture(texture2)
```

**ERROR**: At: core/image.cpp:2175:blit_rect() - Condition ' srcdsize == 0 ' is true.

data.title: Xbox Controller D-PAD is_echo() is not working on HTML export
data.body:
Godot 2.1.4
X11 - Kubuntu 17.04
Chrome Browser 60.0.3112.113 (Official Build) (64-bit)


```
extends Node2D


func _ready():
	set_process_input(true)


func _input(ev):
	if !ev.is_echo() && Input.is_action_pressed("left"):
		print("left")
```

This code has a different behavior on HTML. It prints 4 times "left" on other platforms it only prints once.
The action "left" is Xbox D-Pad Left.

data.title: Fixes order of default arguments in MethodInfo
data.body:
This time for real

Fixes 1. of #10884

data.title: fixed copy on osx + help selection color
StyleBoxSupport for RichTextLabel and cleanup for script+docs backgrounds fixes #10685
data.body:
I reverted the option to override the bg.
Instead each script or docs panel has the same background underneath the RTL (which has a style box now). So setting the script editor bg color to transparent has the exact same effect than the override option.
(except it works with all of them not just the script panel)

Also cleaned up some code which was possible since the RTL now has it's own stylebox.

I'm pretty sure that the RTL works flawlessly with the sb_settings like margin...
But I'm not sure if the implementation is as simple as it could be.
so whoever could review 0f62db2 would be great!

data.title: Added border for tabs + container.
data.body: the highlighting also works for them main viewport now. since they are using the same sb than the other tabs. - moved tabConetent position to be more reasonable. - fixed drawing order to allow those kind of styles. ## [DISCUSSION] all figured out so ready to merge this pr is a discussion to some extend. I wanted to propose the border. but I don't know if it makes sense. It would be really easy to make it another option too. (the border already is dependent on the setting you choose for border width. setting it to 0 removes it of course) - The drawing order fix though makes much more sense since it allows to draw tabs over the container so more style options are possible in general. (also for games made with godot) - also the change, that the same sb is used for the viewport tabs and the dock tabs is good it think. this is how it looks with the light theme:
